intro: Conyza apurensis, commonly known as the Apure dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Conyza apurensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
